English students among the least skilled in the industrialised world

By James Bithell

A recent study by the OECD showed that 16-24 year olds in England are among the least skilled in terms of literacy and numeracy in the industrialised world.

Educating Britain

Tristam Hunt, Labour shadow education secretary, recently appeared on the Andrew Marr show claiming that he, and Ed Miliband, would back parent-run free-schools if they were successful at the next election.

Court discrimination or leaders escaping justice?

Accusations of discrimination have been thrown at the International Criminal Court in recent days due to its focus on investigating African cases, which is seen by many as unfair.

Uganda's democracy in decline

Sarah Vowden discusses the future for Ugandan's democracy. With human rights violations still a regular occurrence under Museveni, should the world take action?

More could be done to ensure justice

As figures show 9 out of 10 people walk free from their first violent crime Will Aske questions what this means for the justice system.

North Korea threaten 'all-out war'

Christy Cooney questions North Korea's intentions following previous disputes involving the two countries.

Mail fail

Tax payers set to lose millions of pounds as the government under-prices the Royal Mail.

National Insurance payment cuts are good but could more be done?

Jack Braund argues that the cuts in National Insurance should be but the first step in the road towards change.

Lecturers and uni staff in first UK-wide strike over pay

Thousands of lecturers and non-academic staff will go on strike over pay on the 31st October, after members of the University and College Union, Unite and Unison each voted for joint action over the coming weeks.

In what is perhaps David Cameron's widest ranging reshuffle since he took office as Prime Minister in 2010, Liberal Democrat Michael Moore has been replaced by Alistair Carmichael as Scottish Secretary.

Callum Elliot explains why we shouldn't be so quick to mark UKIP as racist.

To get the most out of volunteering people should choose to do it themselves rather than being forced into national conscription
